title: Error Boundary doesn't catch TypeError and app crashes
body:
<!--
  Note: if the issue is about documentation or the website, please file it at:
  https://github.com/reactjs/reactjs.org/issues/new
-->
Hello! 

I'm using [component](https://github.com/mozilla-services/react-jsonschema-form) for building web forms from JSON schema and I have a specific scenario in my app. User can fill the form regularly by filling form inputs or **he can toggle to expert area, where it's possible to modify JSON** in code editor. But here comes the problem - if user omits some expected parameters in JSON definition, component will crash and throws errors like those:

> Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'parameters' of undefined ...
> The above error occurred in the <Form\> component: ... 

So I've decided to create **ErrorBoundary** class which I copied from [this](https://reactjs.org/docs/error-boundaries.html) documentation page and placed it as a wrapper of the \<Form\> component this way:

```
<ErrorBoundary>
	<Form
		schema={ dataSchema }
		uiSchema={ editUiSchema }
		formData={ JSON.parse(jsonSettingsString) }
		ArrayFieldTemplate={ ArrayFieldTemplate }
		ObjectFieldTemplate={ ObjectFieldTemplate }
		FieldTemplate={ FieldTemplate }
		className="settings-form"
		onSubmit={ this.submitSettings }
		onError={ onFormError }
		onChange={ this.onJsonSettingsChange }
		showErrorList={ false }
		noHtml5Validate={ true }
		autocomplete="off"
	/>
</ErrorBoundary>
```

But nothing changes ... I've also placed `console.log` to `ErrorBoundary`'s `componentDidCatch` method, but it doesn't log anything...

```
componentDidCatch(error, info) {
    // You can also log the error to an error reporting service
    console.log(error)
    console.log(info)
  }
```

Am I doing something wrong or is it bug in error handling?
